creator: The Reading Club, Inc.
descriptionHtml:
FEATURES ✨

📲 Interactive interface: App responds to user's input word-by-word to make learning to read an engaging and exciting experience.
🔊 Hear words spoken: Tap to hear any word and/or save it for future practice.
✏️ Customize stories: Customize characters, places, and pronouns to create a story that is familiar and memorable.
⭐ Word bank: Identify the words you want to work on and filter by favorites.
📈 Set goals: Set goals and reminders to practice. Specify reading time, difficulty, and specific days and hours.

DETAILED READING METRICS DELIVERED TO YOUR INBOX AS AN EXCEL SPREADSHEET 📊
ALL READING SESSIONS
🔥 Reading time (min): The time reading in minutes.
🔥 Words read: Count of words read during the session.
🔥 Characters read: Count of characters read during the session.
🔥 Reading speed: The average number of pages read per every 10 minutes (a page is defined as 2000 characters).
🔥 Words per minute: The average number of words per minute.
TOTALS ACROSS ALL READING SESSIONS
🔥 Total reading speed: The all-time average number of pages read per every 10 minutes (a page is defined as 2000 characters).
🔥 Total words per minute: The total aggregated number of words read (ever) divided by total reading time (min). That is, the average number of words per minute.
🔥 Total words ever: The total aggregated number of words read (ever) using the app.
🔥 Total characters ever: The total aggregated number of characters read (ever) using the app.
🔥 Total reading time (min): The total aggregated number of minutes of reading time (ever) using the app.
TELL US THE CUSTOM METRICS YOU NEED TO ACHIEVE YOUR READING PRACTICE GOALS
🔥 Any custom metric: Tell us all the fine-grained reading metrics you need (through any of our communication channels) and we will work with you to make sure we add them to the Excel spreadsheet delivered to your inbox.

WRITE YOUR OWN STORIES 📚

If the default set of customization options of the stories in our library is not enough for you, you can write your own custom stories with our state-of-the-art parser and upload them to your own private library. If you follow the simple instructions and tutorial, our software will allow you to make pronouns, characters, locations -- and more -- customizable within the app as well. This will be a great opportunity to create fun memories with your children!

HIGH-QUALITY CONTENT GUIDED BY EXPERTISE 👨‍🔬

Each of our stories has been carefully adapted into each of three reading levels -- Junior, Intermediate, and Advanced -- and their readability score been measured with professional formulas such as the Flesch Kincaid Reading Ease, a widely used readability formula that assesses the approximate reading grade level of a text.

Rest assured you will find consistent and adequate reading levels for your children to enjoy all the books.

SHARE YOUR ACHIEVEMENTS WITH ALL THE FAMILY 🏆

As you progress on your reading adventure, you will be rewarded with certificates of achievement (with your name on it) that you can send to your email, share with friends & family, and even print and put on your wall. This will be a great way to commemorate important milestones such as completing your first chapter, reading 1000 words, achieving a good average reading speed, consistent practice, etc.

Join The Reading Club and get ready to make reading together fun and impactful!
descriptionShort: Interactive learn-to-read app teaches reading together and tracks goals.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
📲 Interactive interface: App responds to user's input word-by-word. Make learning to read an engaging and exciting experience.
🔊 Hear words spoken: Tap to hear any word and/or save it for future practice.
✏️ Customize stories: I.e., characters, places, & pronouns. It all begins with a story that is familiar and memorable.
📋 Word bank: I.e., Identify the words you want to work on, & filter by favorites.
📈 Set goals: Set goals and reminders to practice. I.e., reading time, difficulty, & days.

title: The Reading Club - Make Learning to Read Impactful

creator: The Reading Club, Inc.
descriptionHtml:
Customize stories—characters, places, pronouns, and much more. It all begins with a story that is familiar and memorable.

Welcome to The Reading Club, where you can customize your own stories!

Before you start a story, you can establish the facts about the setting, as well as the names and genders of certain characters. This way, you can make the story your own!

We believe that this will encourage children's engagement with the narrative, so they can play a role in shaping the stories themselves.

The Reading Club is the perfect app for parents and children to read together and improve their reading skills! The app also deepens the emotional and social connection between adults and children while they spend quality time together. With ample evidence from top peer-reviewed academic journals, reading together has numerous benefits for everyone involved. The Reading Club differentiates itself from other reading apps by its purpose—to be used by parents and children together.

With its interactive interface, the app responds to your input word-by-word, helping your child practice and learn to read. You can also tap to hear any word spoken aloud, and even save it for future practice. Plus, you can customize stories by changing characters, places, and pronouns to create a story that is familiar and memorable for your child. And with the app's word bank, you can easily identify the words you want to work on and filter by favorites. Finally, you can set goals and reminders to practice, specify reading time, difficulty, and even specific days and hours.

The Reading Club is a great way for parents to help their young children learn to read. With this app, parents can track their child's progress, send their relatives the certificates of achievement, and even print them out to put on the wall. The Reading Club makes reading together fun and impactful for the entire family!

We hope you enjoy our app and find it helpful in your reading journey!
descriptionShort: Customizable Children's Books: Characters, Pronouns, Locations, And Much More.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
Dear Reading Club users,

We apologize for any inconvenience caused by an urgent bug fix we recently made to addresses subscription issues. Rest assured that we have taken steps to ensure that all subscriptions are now up and running as expected.

We hope you continue to enjoy The Reading Club and all the great content it offers.

Sincerely,
The Reading Club Team

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: Welcome to The Reading Club! We're excited to announce that localized prices are now available in our Google Play store. With this new feature, parents and teachers can now access our exclusive collection of children's books from around the world at an even more affordable price. Plus, our subscription model means you can access even more content for a fraction of the cost. Start your child's literary adventure today!

descriptionShort: Customizable Children's Books: Characters, Pronouns, Locations, And Much More.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
We are thrilled to announce the launch of our new reading analytics feature. Parents can now track their children's reading progress and better understand their reading abilities. With this feature, parents will be able to monitor their children's literacy growth, track the books they are reading, and view data on the time they spend reading.

We hope this new feature helps parents better understand and support their children's reading journey. Download The Reading Club now and get started!

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: We are pleased to announce that we have resolved the issue with the user form layout in landscape mode. The keyboard will no longer block the input field. This issue was reported by a number of users and we thank them for bringing it to our attention. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and are committed to providing the best experience possible. Thank you for your patience.

title: Reading Club: Children's Books

creator: The Reading Club, Inc.
descriptionHtml:
Welcome to The Reading Club. The purpose of this app is to help you make time for a magical shared reading experience with your young and emerging reader — an experience you both will want to return to again and again.

The magic is in the stories, which are deeply creative, beautifully illustrated, and ticklishly funny. The stories are created by gifted storytellers who are also parents of young children AND university professors holding PhDs from universities, including Harvard University and the University of Toronto. Dr. Alexis Diamond (PhD, Harvard), co-founder of The Reading Club and creator of most of the stories, is a professor of Computational Science at Minerva University in San Francisco. Dr. Diamond’s academic work has been cited more than 10,000 times, including most recently in 2023 by NobelPrize.org, in its publication of Dr. Guido Imbens's 2021 Economics Nobel Prize Lecture.

Reading Club stories embed scholarly and academic themes and concepts in math, science, philosophy, and other subjects, and widely accepted human values and aspirations for social life, such as the importance of care, justice, equality, dignity, love, resilience, & respect.

Without compromising fun or readability, our stories raise questions about what these concepts and principles mean given the decisions we make. We know these lofty aspirations may be too much to cover in a simple app, but we’re giving it a shot.

The magic of our stories extends to their customizability. Before starting a story, our readers can customize it (if they wish) by selecting characters' names, genders, pronouns, and locations. Allowing readers to shape their own stories makes them exceptionally engaging.

Our stories were designed to facilitate what is known in academic literature as "shared reading": when emerging readers read a book with support and encouragement of established readers, usually reading together side-by-side. Our founders know from personal experience that shared reading can be a powerful way to strengthen emotional and social bonds with young children. Of course, the Reading Club can also be used by children reading on their own, as well as by students of any age who simply wish to improve their reading skills (including students of English as a Second Language).

Features include the ability to tap a word to hear its pronunciation and a Word Bank where challenging words can be saved for future practice. Readers can also set reminders for regular reading times and reading difficulty levels. There is even an "Analytics" option that will email readers a custom spreadsheet summarizing results metrics such as ‘number of words read’ and ‘number of pages per minute’.

Our small team is also working on gamification to enhance young reader engagement. At the moment, once the child reads a chapter they qualify for membership in the Club and can get a printable certificate. Our development team is working on enhancements that will soon allow members to qualify for badges and other forms of recognition for their reading achievements.

We hope that you find our app promotes positive, helpful, and engaging times with the emerging readers in your life. Feedback (including feature requests!) is always welcomed at: contact@thereadingclubapp.com.
descriptionShort: Customizable Children's Books: Characters, Pronouns, Locations, And Much More.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: Hey parents, we heard your cries of frustration and fixed the notification system! Now, The Reading Club will remind you when it's time to snuggle up and read with your little ones - no more excuses! We know how important this is, so we made sure to get it right. Enjoy the reading!

descriptionShort: Customizable Children's Books: Characters, Pronouns, Locations, And Much More.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: We've got some exciting news to share with you! The Reading Club, our learn-to-read app, just got a huge update with tons of new stories that embed highly engaging themes and concepts in math, science, philosophy, and more. Plus, each story emphasizes widely accepted human values and aspirations for social life, such as the importance of care, justice, equality, dignity, love, resilience, & respect. So why wait? Download The Reading Club now and explore these amazing new stories!

Readers can also set reminders for regular reading times and reading difficulty levels. There is even an "Analytics" option that will email readers a custom spreadsheet summarizing results metrics such as ‘number of words read’ and ‘number of pages per minute’.

Our small team is also working on gamification to enhance young reader engagement. At the moment, once the child reads a chapter they qualify for membership in the Club and can get a printable certificate. Our development team is working on enhancements that will soon allow members to qualify for badges and other forms of recognition for their reading achievements.

We hope that you find our app promotes positive, helpful, and engaging times with the emerging readers in your life. Feedback (including feature requests!) is always welcomed at: contact@thereadingclubapp.com.

title: Reading Club: Children's Books

creator: The Reading Club, Inc.
descriptionHtml:
Welcome to The Reading Club. The purpose of this app is to help you make time for a magical shared reading experience with your young and emerging reader — an experience you both will want to return to again and again.

The magic is in the stories, which are deeply creative, beautifully illustrated, and ticklishly funny. The stories are created by gifted storytellers who are also parents of young children AND university professors holding PhDs from universities, including Harvard University and the University of Toronto. Dr. Alexis Diamond (PhD, Harvard), co-founder of The Reading Club and creator of most of the stories, is a professor of Computational Science at Minerva University in San Francisco. Dr. Diamond’s academic work has been cited more than 10,000 times, including most recently in 2023 by NobelPrize.org, in its publication of Dr. Guido Imbens's 2021 Economics Nobel Prize Lecture.

Reading Club stories embed scholarly and academic themes and concepts in math, science, philosophy, and other subjects, and widely accepted human values and aspirations for social life, such as the importance of care, justice, equality, dignity, love, resilience, & respect.

Without compromising fun or readability, our stories raise questions about what these concepts and principles mean given the decisions we make. We know these lofty aspirations may be too much to cover in a simple app, but we’re giving it a shot.

The magic of our stories extends to their customizability. Before starting a story, our readers can customize it (if they wish) by selecting characters' names, genders, pronouns, and locations. Allowing readers to shape their own stories makes them exceptionally engaging.

Our stories were designed to facilitate what is known in academic literature as "shared reading": when emerging readers read a book with support and encouragement of established readers, usually reading together side-by-side. Our founders know from personal experience that shared reading can be a powerful way to strengthen emotional and social bonds with young children. Of course, the Reading Club can also be used by children reading on their own, as well as by students of any age who simply wish to improve their reading skills (including students of English as a Second Language).

Features include the ability to tap a word to hear its pronunciation and a Word Bank where challenging words can be saved for future practice. Readers can also set reminders for regular reading times and reading difficulty levels. There is even an "Analytics" option that will email readers a custom spreadsheet summarizing results metrics such as ‘number of words read’ and ‘number of pages per minute’.

Our small team is also working on gamification to enhance young reader engagement. At the moment, once the child reads a chapter they qualify for membership in the Club and can get a printable certificate. Our development team is working on enhancements that will soon allow members to qualify for badges and other forms of recognition for their reading achievements.

We hope that you find our app promotes positive, helpful, and engaging times with the emerging readers in your life. Feedback (including feature requests!) is always welcomed at: contact@thereadingclubapp.com.

Dr. Diamond’s academic work has been cited more than 10,000 times, including most recently in 2023 by NobelPrize.org, in its publication of Dr. Guido Imbens's 2021 Economics Nobel Prize Lecture.

Reading Club stories embed scholarly and academic themes and concepts in math, science, philosophy, and other subjects, and widely accepted human values and aspirations for social life, such as the importance of care, justice, equality, dignity, love, resilience, & respect.

Without compromising fun or readability, our stories raise questions about what these concepts and principles mean given the decisions we make. We know these lofty aspirations may be too much to cover in a simple app, but we’re giving it a shot.

The magic of our stories extends to their customizability. Before starting a story, our readers can customize it (if they wish) by selecting characters' names, genders, pronouns, and locations. Allowing readers to shape their own stories makes them exceptionally engaging.

Our stories were designed to facilitate what is known in academic literature as "shared reading": when emerging readers read a book with support and encouragement of established readers, usually reading together side-by-side. Our founders know from personal experience that shared reading can be a powerful way to strengthen emotional and social bonds with young children. Of course, the Reading Club can also be used by children reading on their own, as well as by students of any age who simply wish to improve their reading skills (including students of English as a Second Language).

Features include the ability to tap a word to hear its pronunciation and a Word Bank where challenging words can be saved for future practice. Readers can also set reminders for regular reading times and reading difficulty levels. There is even an "Analytics" option that will email readers a custom spreadsheet summarizing results metrics such as ‘number of words read’ and ‘number of pages per minute’.

Our small team is also working on gamification to enhance young reader engagement. At the moment, once the child reads a chapter they qualify for membership in the Club and can get a printable certificate. Our development team is working on enhancements that will soon allow members to qualify for badges and other forms of recognition for their reading achievements.

We hope that you find our app promotes positive, helpful, and engaging times with the emerging readers in your life. Feedback (including feature requests!) is always welcomed at: contact@thereadingclubapp.com.
descriptionShort: Funny brilliant stories, customize names, etc! Created by Harvard PhD professor

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: We've got some exciting news to share with you! The Reading Club, our learn-to-read app, just got a huge update with tons of new stories that embed highly engaging themes and concepts in math, science, philosophy, and more. Plus, each story emphasizes widely accepted human values and aspirations for social life, such as the importance of care, justice, equality, dignity, love, resilience, & respect. So why wait? Download The Reading Club now and explore these amazing new stories!

title:
Reading Club: Children's Books
7.6

creator: The Reading Club, Inc.
descriptionHtml:
Welcome to The Reading Club. The purpose of this app is to help you make time for a magical shared reading experience with your young and emerging reader — an experience you both will want to return to again and again.

The magic is in the stories, which are deeply creative, beautifully illustrated, and ticklishly funny. The stories are created by gifted storytellers who are also parents of young children AND university professors holding PhDs from universities, including Harvard University and the University of Toronto. Dr. Alexis Diamond (PhD, Harvard), co-founder of The Reading Club and creator of most of the stories, is a professor of Computational Science at Minerva University in San Francisco.
